data.title: Not A Typical Experience
data.text: I was not impressed with this location.  They don't accept Starbucks rewards because they supposedly are owned by the hotel they are located in.  But they will use your Starbucks registered card.  Weird.  Baristas weren't your normal welcoming people.  Drinks were made as ordered but socially not a normal Starbucks experience.  I visit Starbucks all over the world & spend quite a bit in their establishments.  This one is falling short of the mark.

data.title: Good Starbucks Location
data.text: Bigger than most in the area, this service is as expected for a Starbucks. Cleveland Street is the central business district of Clearwater, and it is going through transformation to accomodate more stores/shops.

data.title: Good tea and service
data.text: Good tea and service. Passed through on a day trip to Clearwater while on holidays. Good central location in Clearwater

data.title: Typical Starbucks
data.text: Wonderful coffee as usual.  Great location close to the Capital Theater.  We went in there after the show.

data.title: friendly neighborhood cafe, even from a corporate beast
data.text: It's the people that make Starbucks great.  Stopped here on a 100k bike ride.  I hung out on the patio, had my bike bottles filled with ice water, enjoyed a warm croissant and a cup of joe. What's not to love?

data.title: Starbucks
data.text: I wished that it was located on Clearwater Beach, but it is located across the bridge. As with most places there, you will need to have $ for parking. The service was great and it is worth driving to Starbucks if you want a specialty coffee!

data.title: TYPICAL DOWNTOWN STARBUCKS
data.text: I always go to Starbucks when there is no crowd. Reason: service is way too fast during rush hours. I always feel I am on an assembly line. "Next!"  I like this place when I don't feel rushed, there are no crowds and I can find a table. Many people hang out here with their lap-tops, business spread sheets and iPods. Some even conduct business speaking loudly into their iPhones. I find this rude, very rude. Otherwise, I like Starbucks' coffees and salads even tough I find their prices expensive.

data.title: Good ole' Bucks
data.text: Same menu, same favorite little treats, different place. The staff was very nice and the small outdoor seating area was a nice spot for the family during our trip to Downtown Clearwater this May. Good location for people watching!

data.title: Coffee gone wrong
data.text: Don't get me wrong. The coffee was great. The service, however, was anything but. Not only did all the staff seem very uninterested in the store full of people but the very loud conversation of their time outside work was only made worse by the atrocious language used with all the people, including children around. I absolutly DID report them to corporate because I love Starbucks and to be so disappointed was disheartening.

data.title: Fast, Clean & Professional
data.text: I visited this Starbucks on several occasions during my most recent stay. Even walking in when a line quickly formed, they were able to accommodate everyone quickly. Staff is always friendly and helpful.

data.title: Coffee before Jazz Holiday
data.text: Had a cup of Expresso Roast at this location on my arrival in Clearwater. The location store is beautifully done and space was nicely appointed. The service was fast and cheerful. The barista made conversation and helped with questions regarded a rare roast for sale.

data.title: Over priced
data.text: over priced for fair coffee.  pastries were OK, but I an doo better at a more fair price.  I guess Starbucks is a trendy place to be seen and show off that money is no object.

data.title: Clearwater Starbucks
data.text: This Starbucks is perfectly situated for Scientologist-watching.  I'm not kidding!  They're everywhere!  And they all wear a uniform, with name badges!  And all in trousers, men & women alike.  White tops, black or navy trousers.  There's lots of windows at this Stbx, so you can sip your drink & watch the parade.

data.title: Nice staff
data.text: Went to this starbucks for coffee with a friend. The staff was young attractive women, in good spirits, and friendly. I did not like that the patio was "no smoking". We sat inside and went out for a smoke and back in three times (we were there for maybe four hours catching up on things happened past several years). Coffee was good, tea was good, atmosphere wasnt great, fairly bland corporate feel to the interior. All in all good experience.

data.title: Fantastic Caramel Macchiato
data.text: Great Service, Great Caramel Macchiato! Great Location! Plenty of froth with the espresso, as should be! Sometimes certain Starbucks locations fill the cup with hot skim milk instead of taking the time to execute the froth process.

data.title: Not up to Starbuck's standards
data.text: My husband & I stopped their while riding our bikes in downtown Clearwater.  They have ourdoor seating which would have been a perfect place to sit and enjoy our coffee.  The tables were dirty the floor was strewn with wet & dirty napkins.  There were plenty of workers inside that could have cleaned this area but were busy conversing amongst themselves.  I would walk a couple of blocks down the street to Dunkin Donuts and enjoy their clean outdoor area!

data.title: Not just another Starbucks !
data.text:
O.K...... so you are thinking that this is just another Starbucks but it is not ! Newly renovated and includes an out door area. After you enjoy a "cup o' joe" with some wonderful Pumpkin Bread inside the large interior stroll Downtown Clearwater while sipping your coffee !
The week that I visited for my "cup o' joe" the Staff were very attentive and helpful. 
I give them a big thumbs up. Bring your computer if you want to stay longer.
Corner of Cleveland and Ft. Harrison with General Meter Parking on each side of the Street.
P.S.: Congratulations on the Restoration of the Capitol Theater !

data.title: Long wait in the morning
data.text: This Starbucks is great if you can find a place to park in the morning. Space is very limited downtown. The Capital Theatre is being renovated and 3 of the parking spaces are closed. It doesn't help any that some of the Baristas park in the front of the store that should really be for guests. Some mornings around 8:00 a.m. the place is jammed packed, so there is no such thing as grabbing a specialty cofee and going to work. You will find yourself standing in line for a while. Sometimes it gets loud, but doesn't last long. Most of the Baristas there are very good except for the one that is usually at the cash register who appears to be dazed and confused. The place is clean. The specialty drinks are pricey, but I still go there 3 times a week.  Bring your laptop and come on in.

data.title: It's a Starbucks
data.text: On the plus side, this Starbucks was recently renovated and has a pretty cool decor and has lots of space to sit & enjoy your drinks.  It's centrally located in downtown Clearwater so it's easily accessible.  The not so great aspects of this location is that the parking is limited and it's all parallel street spaces that are metered.  Also, this Starbucks clearly has a lot of regular customers and gives off an exclusive vibe.  I've stood in line several times and watched the baristas call customers in front of me by name & have very warm, engaging exchanges with them.  However, as I'm not a regular, I'm made very aware of that because the baristas' quick switch to an icy, business-as-usual tone with me.  Not unpleasant but not nearly as inviting.

data.title: recently remodeled
data.text:
Outside seating is ample, inside is spacious. 
On a whim, I recently tried the Pumpkin Spice.  It was really good, only my grande was only 3/4's full. 
The service is generally only perfunctory.

If you're sightseeing,  this is  a good place to get a visual impression, because it's located in the heart of
downtown. 
You can walk a couple of blocks in either direction and see most of what the town is about. 
The old Capitol Theater is a few doors down.
There's an elite formal wear shop next door but I've never been there when its open.
For the most part, the town seems forsaken except for Starbucks.
